name: Borderland
tile: Alice in Borderland is an adventure story of a boy named Alice

name: The Silent Patient
tile: A psychological thriller about a woman's act of violence against her husbandâ€”and of the therapist obsessed with uncovering her motive.

name: The Midnight Library
tile: A story about all the lives we could live and finding the one that is right for you.

name: Becoming
tile: A deeply personal memoir by the former First Lady of the United States, Michelle Obama.

name: Educated
tile: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

name: Where the Crawdads Sing
tile: A novel about a woman who grows up in the swamps of North Carolina and becomes a suspect in a murder case.
George Orwell's dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance, censorship, and torture to control its citizens.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
tile: Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about racial inequality in the Deep South.

name: The Great Gatsby
tile: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel about the American Dream and the roaring twenties.

name: Pride and Prejudice
tile: Jane Austen's romantic novel about manners, marriage, and society in early 19th-century England.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
tile: J.D. Salinger's novel about a young man's journey through New York City.

name: The Hobbit
tile: J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy novel about a hobbit's adventure to reclaim a lost kingdom.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
tile: The first book in J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series about a young wizard's adventures at Hogwarts.

name: The Hunger Games
tile: Suzanne Collins' dystopian novel about a deadly competition in a totalitarian society.

name: Dune
tile: Frank Herbert's science fiction novel about a desert planet and a young man's rise to power.

name: The Alchemist
tile: Paulo Coelho's novel about a shepherd's journey to fulfill his Personal Legend.

name: The Book Thief
tile: Markus Zusak's novel about a young girl in Nazi Germany who finds solace in stealing books.

name: The Fault in Our Stars
tile: John Green's novel about two teenagers with cancer who fall in love.

name: The Giver
tile: Lois Lowry's novel about a dystopian society and a boy who learns the truth about his world.

name: A Game of Thrones
tile: George R.R. Martin's epic fantasy novel about noble families vying for control of the Iron Throne.
